trans-unit.source: Specifies the base class for any UI element that appears on the [!INCLUDE[wf2](~/add/includes/wf2-md.md)] designer canvas and that visually represents an instance of an atomic item that can be edited.
Examples of items represented by a WorkflowViewElement include <xref:System.Activities.Activity> and <xref:System.Activities.Statements.FlowNode>.
`WorkflowViewElement` provides a common contract that the designer uses to render the visual element onto the designer surface and to interact with it through the various editing actions.
If you are building a designer for an <xref:System.Activities.Activity>, you should use the <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.ActivityDesigner> base type.

If there are non-activity elements that need to be treated as first class items on the designer canvas, such as a toolbox item that needs to be draggable throughout the canvas, or for cut-and-paste scenarios, use `WorkflowViewElement` as the base class.
If you do not want to use the standard activity chrome for an activity designer, `WorkflowViewElement` should be used as the base type to provide the most flexibility.

A WorkflowViewElement represents a <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.Model.ModelItem> in the UI and provides code access to the model item and an <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.EditingContext> that allows changes to be made.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.WorkflowViewElement"></xref> class.
The <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.WorkflowViewElement.Collapsible%2A> property is set to `false` by default.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the element can be collapsed.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the element can be collapsed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the list of all composite views.
The list of all composite views.
Gets or sets the editing context that is shared by all elements contained in a workflow designer.

The <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.EditingContext> object is a collection of services shared between all elements contained in the designer and used to interact between the host and the designer.
Services are published and requested through the <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.EditingContext>.
The <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.EditingContext"></xref> object for the workflow designer that contains the workflow view element.
Identifies the <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.WorkflowViewElement.Context*> dependency property.
This is a read-only field.
To be added.
Gets the default composite view.
The default composite view.
Gets the designer associated with the workflow view element.
The designer associated with the workflow view element.
Gets or sets the drag handle for the workflow view element.
The drag handle for the workflow view element.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the view state of the element is expanded.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the view state of the element is expanded; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.WorkflowViewElement.ExpandState*> dependency property.
This is a read-only field.
To be added.
When implemented in a derived class, retrieves the automation help text.
Implement this method in your derived class to add your own handling.
The default implementation is to return an empty <xref:System.String>.
When implemented in a derived class, gets the name of a property of the model item associated with the element that is used as automation ID.
Implement this method in your derived class to add your own handling that specifies a property of a model item to be used to identify the model item to automation.
The name to use as automation ID.
The base class always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
When implemented in a derived class, retrieves the automation item status.
The default implementation is to return an empty <xref:System.String>.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the workflow view element is read only.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the element is read only; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the specified designer is the root designer for this element.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the specified designer is the root designer; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the underlying <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.Model.ModelItem"></xref> object associated with the workflow view element.
The <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.Model.ModelItem> object provides notification of changes even if the model instance does not provide change notification.
A <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.Model.ModelItem"></xref> object that is a wrapper around a model instance or an in-memory representation of the underlying workflow.
Identifies the <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.WorkflowViewElement.ModelItem*> dependency property.
This is a read-only field.
To be added.
Invoked when the context menu is loaded.
Implement this method in a derived class to handle this event.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu"></xref> that is loaded.

Returns a <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.WorkflowViewElement"></xref>-specific <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> implementation for the [!INCLUDE[avalon1](~/add/includes/avalon1-md.md)] infrastructure.
The type-specific <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> implementation.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.DragEnter"></xref> event.
The <xref href="System.Windows.DragEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.DragOver"></xref> event.
The <xref href="System.Windows.DragEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Occurs when the annotation is edited.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Initialized"></xref> event.
The default implementation of this virtual method raises the event as described above.
Overrides should call the base implementation to preserve this behavior.
The <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Invoked when the underlying model item is changed.
Implement this method in a derived class to handle this event.
There is no default implementation.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the changed state of the model item.
Invoked when the mouse button is pressed.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs"></xref> instance that contains the event data.
This event data reports details about the mouse button that was pressed and the state handled.
Invoked when the mouse is moved.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Input.MouseEventArgs"></xref> instance that contains the event data.
Invoked when the mouse button is released.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs"></xref> instance that contains the event data.
The event data reports that the mouse button was released.
Invoked when an unhandled drag attached to the specified event enters an element in its route that is derived from this class.
The <xref href="System.Windows.DragEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Invoked when an unhandled drag attached to the specified event leaves an element in its route that is derived from this class.
The <xref href="System.Windows.DragEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Invoked when an unhandled mouse release attached to the specified event reaches an element in its route that is derived from this class.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
The event data reports that one or more mouse buttons were released.
Invoked when the read-only property is changed.
There is no default implementation.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate that the element is read-only; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Invoked when the show expanded property is changed.
There is no default implementation.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate that the value of the show expanded property is changed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.WorkflowViewElement.ExpandState*> property should take precedence over other states that can be used to expand or collapse the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.WorkflowViewElement"></xref>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.WorkflowViewElement.ExpandState*> property should be used to expand or collapse the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.WorkflowViewElement"></xref> object; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.WorkflowViewElement.PinState*> dependency property.
This is a read-only field.
To be added.
Adds the specified composite view to the list of composite views.
The composite view to register.
Adds the specified composite view as the default composite view.
The composite view.
Gets a value that indicates whether the workflow view element is shown in an expanded view.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the element is shown in an expanded view; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.WorkflowViewElement.ShowExpanded*> dependency property.
This is a read-only field.
To be added.
Removes the specified composite view from the list of composite views.
The composite view to unregister.
Removes the specified default composite view.
The composite view to remove.
Gets the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.Services.ViewService"></xref> associated with the workflow view element.
This property can also be accessed with the <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.EditingContext.Services%2A> property.
The view service associated with the workflow view element.
Gets the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.ViewStateService"></xref> defined in the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.EditingContext"></xref>.
A shortcut to this property is by accessing <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.EditingContext.Services*>.
The <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.ViewStateService"></xref> defined in the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.EditingContext"></xref>.
